results.headline: Mired Below Ground in an Endless Winter
results.summary_short: The sci-fi thriller “The Colony” focuses on a struggling underground colony on a perpetually wintry Earth of the future.

results.headline: Blasting Through the Dance Wars
results.summary_short: A bawdy college kegger has a possible extraterrestrial mystery in “+1.” The 3-D “Battle of the Year” has a dance team preparing for competition.

results.headline: A Loner Finds Bad Company
results.summary_short: In “A Single Shot,” a loner living in a trailer finds — and throws himself into — a world of trouble when he has to deal with a dead woman and found cash.

results.headline: The Warrior as Nurturer
results.summary_short: “Arise” turns a lens on women battling environmental ills around the world.

results.headline: Heroes or Killers? Can We Try to Discuss?
results.summary_short: The documentary “After Tiller” tells the story of four doctors who it says are the only ones in the United States openly performing third-trimester abortions.

results.headline: Love and Paranoia in Brooklyn: Yes, They Inhale. Repeatedly.
results.summary_short: In “Newlyweeds,” a man and a woman in Brooklyn love the pot they smoke as much as they love each other.

results.headline: The Woman Who Knew Too Much

results.headline: A Descent Chronicled With Care
results.summary_short: In “First Cousin Once Removed,” Alan Berliner looks at Edwin Honig’s life as Alzheimer’s took its toll.

results.headline: Trying to Be a Parent, for Better or for Worse
results.summary_short: “Mother of George,” Andrew Dosunmu’s new drama, is not only an assimilation story, but also a keenly observed tale of two people seeking guidance in painful and complicated circumstances.

results.headline: A Little Ditty That Became an Anthem of Hip-Hop
results.summary_short: “Sample This,” from Dan Forrer, revisits the birth of hip-hop through “Apache,” by the Incredible Bongo Band.

results.headline: An All-Too-Human Federal Reserve
results.summary_short: In the documentary “Money for Nothing,” Federal Reserve officials are shown as having great influence, if not great insights.

results.headline: Silly Girl, You Want to Race a Boy?
